reviewDescription: Experience enhanced power convenience and protection with the QINLIANF 5 Outlet Extender equipped with 4 USB Charging Ports. This versatile surge protector is designed to meet your power needs while keeping your devices safe from unexpected electrical surges. With its combination of outlets and USB ports, it's the perfect solution for home, office, or travel use. Here's why the QINLIANF Wall Charger Surge Protector is an essential addition to your power setup:Expanded Power Outlets and USB Ports (5/5):Enjoy the convenience of five AC outlets and four USB charging ports with the QINLIANF Wall Charger Surge Protector. Whether you need to power multiple electronic devices or charge your smartphones, tablets, and other USB-powered gadgets, this extender provides ample options for all your power needs in one compact unit.Surge Protection for Peace of Mind (5/5):Protect your valuable electronics from damaging power surges with the built-in surge protection of the QINLIANF Wall Charger Surge Protector. Designed to safeguard your devices against voltage spikes and fluctuations, this surge protector provides peace of mind, ensuring that your electronics stay safe and functional.Space-Saving Design (5/5):Maximize your available wall outlet space with the compact and space-saving design of the QINLIANF Wall Charger Surge Protector. Its sleek and low-profile design fits flush against the wall, making it ideal for use in tight spaces, behind furniture, or in areas with limited outlet access.Fast and Efficient Charging (5/5):Charge your devices quickly and efficiently with the high-speed USB charging ports of the QINLIANF Wall Charger Surge Protector. Equipped with smart charging technology, these ports automatically detect your device's power requirements and deliver optimal charging speeds for maximum efficiency.Versatile Power Solution (5/5):Experience versatile power solutions for home, office, or travel use with the QINLIANF Wall Charger Surge Protector. Whether you're charging your smartphones, tablets, laptops, or powering your electronic appliances, this extender offers the flexibility and convenience you need to stay connected and productive.Conclusion: Stay Powered and Protected with QINLIANF Wall Charger Surge ProtectorIn conclusion, the QINLIANF Wall Charger Surge Protector is the ultimate solution for expanding your power options while ensuring the safety of your devices. With its multiple outlets, USB charging ports, surge protection, space-saving design, and fast charging capabilities, it's the perfect accessory for any home, office, or travel setup. Stay powered, connected, and protected with the QINLIANF Wall Charger Surge Protector.

reviewTitle: GREAT Surge Protection, USB ports, outlet spacing and price! Standard (not fast speed) USB C charge
reviewDescription: So, this surge protector and power strip has a lot of protection when it comes to surge protection!  At the top end of what you will find for general electronics, this one has 1680 joules of protection before it gets fried to save everything thats plugged into it. If you have any high end gaming computers, REALLY expensive electronics, you would purchase an expensive/entire next level surge protector having over 2000 (2K) joules of protection.  So this surge protector packs a punch for all regular electronics, regular computer equipment.The lit up center green button shows that the surge protection is still working and has not been fried by a lightening hit or something. If it does one day get fried, this whole unit will still work as a power strip but would no longer provide the surge protection for the devices plugged into it.I mounted this charger and plugged in some "hard to plug in" electrical cords and this thing held sturdy!  I was impressed at how sturdy it was when I had to really give an extra push or pull to some of my plugs going into or pulling out of it.Each of the three USB A (same as saying USB) port is 12 Watts. This matches the highest capacity of most USB A cords, so this is good. It also is great that EACH USB A port has this capacity, so plugging in multiple devices into these ports will not create a slow down on the others, which is great!The one USB C port is 15 Watts but not a fast charging port.  So it may take 56 minutes to charge the same as what a fast charger would take 34 minutes, as an accurate example. I am fine with that.. But good to be aware that this will not charge as fast as a "fast charger" if you have one of those elsewhere in the house.  And if you do, you could always plug that fast charger into one of the traditional outlets on this power strip and achieve your fast charging effect that way!The traditional electrical ports are well spaced and VERY handy.The price is GREAT!  A GREAT bargain!This purchase is an excellent one!

This was an easy way to upgrade the outlets in our home without having to replace the receptacle.  Not only does it allow us to plug in our USB devices but gives us more outlets for lamps, TV, media devices, etc.  Very handy and seem to provide adequate USB power.  Does not provide the high amp charging many cell phones have today but works well with my wireless phone charger.

Makes a very convenient charging station for my night stand. I am able to plug in my phone watch and ear buds and have a lamp with ports to spare. Very nice profile fits behind nightstand and still easy to plug and unplug things. The center screw keeps it secure and works great.

reviewTitle: This was exactly what I needed for my myriad of devices.
reviewDescription: I got 2.  One for the kitchen and one for the bedroom.  I love the fact that it has multiple places to plug in my lamp, etc.as well as multiple USB slots for all my devices.  This is very handy, works great and was a great value.  I got them on sale which was a definite bonus!  I will likely buy more.

When we built a kitchen island in our home, I begged for an outlet there and after much hemming and hawing, we finally got one!  As any modern homeowner can tell you though, one outlet is not enough for a kitchen island.  In looking at the outlet extender options out there, this one is relatively attractive in comparison, very inexpensive, and adds so much functionality to a frequently used part of our home.  I've had for a few weeks now and all the ports work great and we are using a lot of these plugs!  Install was literally plug and play (we didn't screw it in).  I would gladly recommend this to a friend or family member.

This wall charger is multifaced and resourceful product. I am using it at my kitchen and around the enterainment center.It is functionaing well and I can charge mulitple devices through one outlet. This product is very easy to install and works great.Through device I can organize the wires at one location and avoid the mess.

reviewTitle: Great Design!  Just note that USB-C does not have fast charge capability
reviewDescription: I have been looking for a charger like this for a long time.  One that doesn't crowd the plug-in ports because so many plugs today have the big head, or the cord that hangs down so it's impossible to use it on a strip without losing 1 or 2 neighboring outlet ports.  That crowding also makes it difficult to use the USB ports when they are located in the middle between 2 other plug-ins.  This is well thought out in that respect. Also with an indented back to allow it to sit flush against the wall even if you don't remove the face plate on existing socket.  I didn't think about the USB-C wattage required to properly charge my iPhone, but that was my own ignorance as it is mentioned in the details.  I have a work around for that though, so not a big deal, just thought I should mention in case someone else is ignorant as I was!  ;-).  Nice that it comes in either black or white, I got one of each and when my husband saw them he proclaimed that he needed a couple as well!  Happy.

I bought two of these plugs for the bedroom night stands. We have our lights, alarm clocks, phone chargers and watch chargers all plugged into one place. No extension cords needed. I don't think I would use these for multiple high load appliances, like microwaves and hair dryers, but I think they do a good job for what I am using them for. The housing seems to be well made and the plugs are solid and the plugs are not loose. I think future models will probably need more of the USB-C outlets, as that seems to be the new standard. Fortunately, I haven't had to test the surge protection, but hope that it works as advertised. I'm happy with them so far, and would purchase more if I needed them.

reviewTitle: This wall is nice to have.
reviewDescription: The outlet has been a game changer for me, as it has helped to declutter my space and make charging my devices much more efficient. While I wish it charged my phone a bit faster, I can't deny that it has served its purpose well.I would highly recommend this wall outlet to anyone looking for a convenient and practical solution for charging their devices. Despite its slightly slow charging speed, the benefits of having built-in USB connectors far outweigh this minor inconvenience. Overall, I am very satisfied with my purchase and would definitely recommend it to others.No issues here in regards to anything catching on fire either. I have a gaming PC and 2 monitors along with a router and gaming mouse charging station on outlet.

I am happy with this purchase.  I had an outlet extender prior to this one that would not stay in the wall due to all of the plugs.  This on screws right into the outlet so my computer stays on without glitching.  This has been a game changer in my office.

I only returned the product because it will not work in my square outlets. It is only compatible with the more round outlets with the screw in the middle. Although the seller showed the square outlets next to the round outlets and indicated the gap needed between the two, it DOES NOT WORK in the rectangle outlet because there is not screw in the middle of the outlet to put the screw into. Although it mentions not working with GFCI outlets, what they meant was any outlet shaped that way. They took it back with no problems.
It clearly says not to use the outlets for a high draw space heater which is a good thing. I use it in the bedroom for light clock, charge my phone with inductive charge pad etc.

Not much of a test with only two days use!  So far, all outlets and usb ports work perfect.  It is plugged in on a double GFCI double outlet, so as the instructions stated, I cut off the lower plastic post so I could seat the unit fully into my wall outlets.

Installed two of these in the house. One in a teens bedroom and one in the kitchen where everyone who visits tends to charge their phones. I like that you can screw it in. I have 2 more in my cart since they are still on sale (998). I would definitely by the black one if it were on sale. Hope they last.
Pros: easy to install, with only two screw and it is secure, used on basement-Love the multiple plug- like the usb, i used it all the time- Good for my investment|Cons: none
I got this on a flash deal for 9 bucks and it extremely handy. I can charge everything that I need to in one spot instead of taking up multiple outlets and cords everywhere. Highly recommend.

reviewTitle: Easy to use, install, no cords, easy to hook up 110 volt cords to it; no crowding.
reviewDescription: It has more than enough usb and 110 volt outlets. No 110 volt cord to mess with.  It quickly mounts sturdily if it is only for a temporary location. I like the center screw that very securely mounts the unit to the existing wall outlet. Has a small green light to let you know it is on & surge protector is working. For traveling I would get a smaller model. Has an 1875 watt max use. But the instructions are clear; especially warning you NOT TO HOOK UP a continuous 1000 Plus watt appliance. (eg: space heaters). Instead hook 1000+ directly to outlet. You risk melting most extension devices or cords, even heavy duty ones.

reviewTitle: Take your outlets to the next level.
reviewDescription: Love these things. I love that it screws in so it won’t fall off. I love how many different types of cables it will take. Perfect for a highly used outlet in your home!
I love the 45 degree plugs, it helps to utilize all plugs without having any covered by power blocks.  The USB ports seem to charge quickly as well.  10/10 would buy again.

reviewTitle: Surge Protection, basic low-powered 5v USC charging, and 5 outlets spaced out well.
reviewDescription: This is the third "Surge Protector and Outlets" brick over outlet product I've purchased.  This one is ok and fit my application. Seems well built, anchors well to the socket with the included screw, and the threading is a US standard 6-32 threading.Similar units I had in the past had a recessed screw which required a precision screwdriver to fit in the hole... this unit doesn't have that problem... the screw is long and it doesn't recess deep at all.  Very quick and easy installation.Pros:- 5 AC outlets with surge protector- some low-power 5v outlets- 6-32 threaded anchor screw... which doesn't recess into a deep holeCons:- Nightlight / Power LED would be nice.- Top of the unit is SLANTED and can NOT be used as a shelf (ie for when charging your phone).  There are better units if you want a LED or even a light-sensing nightlight... or even a shelf for holding a gadget while charging with the USB units.  Also, the charging isn't a Power Delivery 3.0 or 3.1 protocol.  You won't get anything but 5v out of these ports... they're only good for small low-powered devices.  There are better options out there if you need a true PD 3.0 or 3.1 GaN charger.

reviewTitle: Works well, but didn't fit properly on a decor outlet
reviewDescription: I got this Qinlianf HR-519D outlet device for my bedside night table, to allow me to plug in a light, clock and other device, as well as a cell phone, Fitbit and whatever may come in the future. I had a decor outlet in that location (see my photo to learn what a decor outlet is) and the Qinlianf HR-519D did not fit well over the decor outlet. I tried it both with the trim plate on the decor outlet, as well as the trim plate off. It did not fit well either way -- the blades on the back of the Qinlianf HR-519D did not insert fully into the decor receptacle. The first couple times I tried it, the Qinlianf HR-519D worked its way loose and the devices I had plugged into it lost power.To make the Qinlianf HR-519D work reliably, I had to replace the decor outlet with a standard outlet. That way, I could use the long screw that comes with the Qinlianf HR-519D to hold it into the outlet firmly. Now that there is no possibility of the Qinlianf HR-519D pulling out of the socket, it works really well. I like having all the standard AC sockets, as well as the USB ports.I got the Qinlianf HR-519D for a great price, and I like having the convenience of multiple AC receptacles and USB ports in a handy location. I have not had it in service very long, but it seems well built -- assuming it lasts, it is a good product.

So I do love it but it has one flaw. It's not very secure. It keeps falling out the wall but that's potentially a problem unique to certain people. It has a screw that will secure it but it's in the center so if your outlet is screwed in elsewhere it will definitely fall out.. a lot. So that's pretty much my only gripe. As long as you have a center screw 5 stars easy if not 4 or less depending how tolerate you are of it. It can be avoided by holding it in whenever you plug or unplug. It's annoying but manageable I guess.TLDR: If your outlet has a screw in the center get it. It's great. If not I don't recommend as it will fall out a lot.

After recognizing the necessity for a versatile wall charger capable of accommodating a variety of devices, ranging from lamps to phones, radios, computers, shredders, and even art sharpeners, I decided to test out this particular product.In my initial week of use, I've been pleasantly surprised to find that it has surpassed my expectations. Installation was a straightforward process, and I particularly appreciate its adaptability in accommodating both traditional plugs and USB charging cables.I wholeheartedly recommend this product based on my positive experience thus far in accommodating all the aforementioned mechanics.  Moreover, considering its affordable price point of just $10.60 inclusive of taxes, I find it to offer exceptional value for the functionality it provides.

reviewTitle: Convenient Charging Hub for All Your Devices
reviewDescription: The QINLIANF Wall Charger and Surge Protector has been a game-changer for my electronic charging needs. With 5 outlets and 4 USB charging ports, it's incredibly convenient, allowing me to charge multiple devices simultaneously. The design is sleek, and it fits well in any room without being an eyesore. My only nitpick is that the USB ports could charge a bit faster, but this is a minor issue compared to the overall functionality and protection it provides against power surges. A great buy for tech-savvy households.

These are great so far. They easily plug in to any normal plug. Love how they offer 4 charging ports. I always had cords all over the counter for people to charge their phones. I also had different blocks plugged in. Became a hassle when we needed the plug for other things. My husband wanted me to order him some for the guest house he was building at the ranch. Think I may order a few more for our office. Great buy.

reviewTitle: To me the extra plugging space was what I needed.
reviewDescription: This item was bought for the bedroom which has only 2 outlets in it. I prefer to use it instead of a extinction cord because it plugs directly into the wall. I scored the item a 4 instead of 5 because I haven't tested the charging ports yet to see how they work.

Very helpful to add to outlet and allow for more versatile use of our outlet. The only downsides are the larger size it takes up around the outlet area and the plastic grounding plug. Easy to break off the plastic grounding piece and easily fits into outlet without further issue.

reviewTitle: Add USB ports to the sides, otherwise very nice product
reviewDescription: I just bought this wall charger, outlet multiplier, and I think it's a nice product. But I do have one small gripe: add some USB ports to a side, not all the USB ports should be on the front. Found this to be nearly universal on these type products.

This item was easy to install and has all of the outlets I need to be able to charge my phone, my kindle and plug in 5 items at the same time.  I don't need all of them at one time but it is nice to have options.

We had replaced outlets on our kitchen island and bedsides with usb outlets in our house so I was pretty sad when we became renters because we can’t modify them. These were the perfect solution! Better, even, thanks to the extra outlets and the USB-C port. They fit pretty snugly without the screw but it does lock it in place really nice. Great way to upgrade your outlets without needing to replace it, especially for renters!
This is a terrific product that does exactly what it says it is supposed to do. You simply plug it in and it gives you lots of options and room to plug other appliances and phone chargers, etc. into.

Arrived quickly, easy to install, cleans up cord mess, unobtrusive, even my wife commented on how perfect they were. The USB charging points will be handy when the grandkids come with all their smart phones, tablets and the such.

reviewTitle: Solves the previous tangle of cords
reviewDescription: Bought 2,  1 for use in kitchen to charge laptops & phones & second 1 in bedroom to get rid of a mass of cords stretching out to an inconvenient electrical outlet.  Works great in both locations.

Prior to this, in an outlet we had plugged in multi-outlet adaptors, extension cords, phone chargers etc. - this does away with all of those, it provides more outlets and is so much neater. with fewer cords trailing around.

Harvey’s in campers are limited on their outlets. This allows to plug in more items without replacing the hardware already in your outlets. It fits in all of the outlets inconspicuously, and is very nice to look at.
There’s never enough outlets in the bathroom for your hair and makeup accessories and with this you can listen to music and charge your phone and get ready at the same time. It’s a win win product

I like this outlet because it has USB charging in addition to the 110 outlets.  The 3-dimentional layout of the 110 outlets allows larger plugs and charging units to fit, without the usual space limitations.

It’s clear that products like this are drop shipped there’s like 1000 different listings with this same photo. I had bought these same style but with all USB-C from another vendor and it was awful, literally wouldn’t stay in the outlet and would fall out of the outlet throughout the day/night. I bought this was holding it would be better. It works great. Am currently using all of the outlets and it’s still snug in the outlet. I didn’t even need to screw it into the outlet plate. Wouldn’t say it’s anything fancy but for $9 it’s well worth it.

I bought one of these to put over the outlet next to my bed, I've always just used a regular power strip/surge protector that sits on my nightstand to charge all my devices, but my girlfriend has informed me that it was very ugly to have a power strip on a nightstand....well this product saved me from her judgment. It definitely does look much nicer than my previous setup, and still offers just as many outlets, more if you include the USB ports, as well as surge protection. Best of all, it's girlfriend decor approved. Highly recommend.

reviewTitle: Handier than pockets on a shirt!
reviewDescription: Simple to install. A good design. I don't know how I got along without one. All of my new devices fot the bathroom need a USB charger. This is great!

First, I use them in areas of my old house that have limited outlets. If I use anything that draws a lot of amps, it's the only thing plugged in it besides a lamp or computer. These fit tight and the USB charge fast. Highly recommended.

I bought several of these I had outlets with charger adapters hanging off of them and decided I needed a different outlet. And these worked great, I did have to take a small piece off the top of one of them to get it to fit under the molding

This is an awesome product. The one i had kept falling out of the wall and really frustrated me. Bought this and i love it. Also love the usb ports built in!  You won’t be sorry you bought it!  I plan to buy more.

I have several different wall outlets which also feature USB ports. This unit with slanted sides I find more versatile in the space I need it because the slanted side outlets are easier to access than outlets in a square or rectangle unit. Although it is not necessary to use the center screw, I find that the screw gives added stability when unplugging an item. Note that you do need to pay attention to measurements given, as this design might not work everywhere.

reviewTitle: Nicley designed multi outlet extender w USB charge ports
reviewDescription: the outlet is perfect for all the different shapes and sizes of plugs we are tasked with "plugging" in. It has a crisp clean look and being able to plug in FIVE different plugs PLUS 4 USB is FABULOUS! the spacing of the outlets creates a clean orderly look.  good product so far!
This is very nice it has a screw that holes it in the wall not like the cheaper ones that fall out when you put heavy plugs in it.

I used it to bring a vintage motor home's power outlets into the current decade.  One in the living area and one behind the entertainment system, and we can now plug in everything with no problem.  They're easy to install and they look great.

reviewTitle: 6 plug ins. 3 USB and I USBC! Awesome
reviewDescription: Took 30 seconds to remove the face plate and put this on. It’s better than expected and has a lot more use for a communal spot in the kitchen.

reviewTitle: Great replacement for a long surge protector
reviewDescription: I was able to plug in my lamps, Show, and charging station as well as have USB ports for my iPad and my Kindle. Each of the power cords/charging blocsk is a different size and having this unit accommodated all of them without an issue.

I like to sit in my reclining chair and talk on my cell. Power kept running out. Saw the charger and bought it.PERFECT SOLUTION! I can sit my chair and simply plug my phone in and it charges quickly! No  need to run and look for the charger. I got pink. So everyone knows it's mine.Real good value for the price. Now I want more for other rooms. Deb

This outlet extender was just what I needed to eliminate the extension chord and phone charger mess that had taken over my end table.  Installation involved plugging the unit into an existing grounded electrical outlet.  What could be easier?  So, if you’re tired of wire rat’s nests taking over your domicile, give these a shot.

We upgraded to this model since more and more USB-C devices are becoming common in our household, but we still have numerous USB-A devices. So it’s a good transition. Charges quickly, depending on the device. Haven’t had any issues or complaints from household. We’ve charged an iPhone 15 Pro, Bose speaker, iPhone 11 on a Qi pad, and powered a baby monitor with no problem. Great value at this price.

This is convenient and easy to use. I like having one spot for all my charging cords and not having to plug in one at a time and then switch them out - or have items charging in every wall outlet in the house. I like being able to plug the cords directly into this. I can keep my lamp plugged in at the same time because I don't have a clunky adapter (or 2) plugged in. I even got one for my octogenarian mother so she could plug her charger cords directly into it and not have to keep finding the appropriate piece that plugs into the wall socket for each item she charges. I gifted a 3rd one to my daughter and SIL, who have 4 people charging things in their household. I haven't had any feedback from them, but I think it would be particularly useful for a multi-person household. I have not had any problems with it since I started using it a couple months ago.

Thomas Edison wanted home electricity to be low-voltage DC.  George Westinghouse thought high-voltage AC would be better.  AC won . . . initially, but NOW homes are using more and more DC "battery" (rechargeable) low voltage devices!  NEED to have "charging" and doing charging off a computer USB port is NOT particularly healthy or prudent for the computer power supply.  But with now having added https://amazon.com/dp/B0C9CSVSNY LED "mag-clamp" lights to several other "rechargeable" devices [several LED high-power flashlights, digital pocket camera] accumulating CORDS plus needing a BETTER charging place!  This QINLIANF 5 Outlet Extender with 4 USB Charging Ports makes any standard wall-outlet a charging-station yet maintains regular outlet for lamp or whatever.  HANDY (travel?  Hadn't figured--but little larger than "diabetic finger puncture kit/meter" so should travel well if remember to yank from whatever its usual spot will become.  If remember also take needed charging cord(s) -- but MY devices are  mostly "stay at home" use {rural America-- no cell signal so no cell phone}

I purchased these for a home built in the mid 90s, renovated mid 2014.  There was still not enough outlets in guest bedrooms & other locations throughout the home.  The product was purchased as a great sale item.  Good product, multiple electronic outlets.

I work at home and this is such a space saver so much better than the long bulky ones that sat on the floor . Also have one in the bedroom and recommend to my sister who bought a similar one just a little smaller

I love having the extra receptacles with USB and C ports. It charges my phone quickly as well. You can’t go wrong with this wall plug if you’re tired of struggling to find charging blocks. Do yourself a favor and order it immediately.

I needed more outlets next to my desk, and without having to change a slightly worn out duplex outlet in that location, this attachment was perfect. The added bonus of USB & USB C was a no brainier for me. Note: my cat kept grabbing my charging cables, pulling the charging blocks out of the outlet. The multiple new ones are very tight, which is what I hoped for. The center screw keeps the unit firmly in place. Haven't had one plug pulled out since I installed it! 😁 Bad kitty!

Bought three of these to use in places where I needed outlets on the side plus USB charging ports and surge protection. So far it met my needs and I well pleased. If I need any more I would reorder these.

This wall charger has enough plugs to make it easy for me to charge my phone while also being able to plug in my light, etc. Easy to install with enough plugs for my phone to charge while my light, etc. is plugged in. Yes, I would recommend this wall charger to anyone.
Not only does it give me more sockets for standard plugs, it allows me to use the charging cords for a variety of wires.  This has really com in handy, and it's a reasonable price too.
My elderly father was unplugging one item to put in another so got this for him so he could have multiple plugs for his electronics while also giving you access to the plugs.

This worked just as described no issues at all so far works great ..be sure u leave ur original wall plug plate on just remove the tiny middle screw that is holding it on remove it to make room for that long screw that the new adapter comes with cause it's the original wall plate that helps make the new adapter fit nice tight an sturdy fit if not u will not fit nice an tight it will be wobbly

reviewTitle: Clean space with lots of plug-ins
reviewDescription: Have one in multiple rooms and the floor is much cleaner without a charging strip on the ground. It also saves me from needing AC plugs for all my USB charging devices.
Like how it screws in to the hole on the out let. Will not come out. It fits perfectly over a standard face plate. Will not sit flush with an oversized faceplate.

Only bought this because it was half off and was useful in the kitchen to charge multiple devices. Installs fast if you can do a little house wiring. Seems to work fine.  Stays green to signal everything works. Also be careful you don't overload more than 15 amps just because it has 5 outlets.
Allows us to charge health watches, laptops, lamps, vacuum cleaners, humidifiers, cell phones, etc - multiple things at once - without having to unplug the lamps we want plugged in all the time.
You remove the switch plate cover and this actually screws in, which makes it very stable.  I love that I can charge all of my devices at one time! Will buy again.
We've been using this wall charger for months and have had no problems.  I have 3 USBs plugged in and 4 electrical plugs plugged in.  I would recommend this product.

Bought five. Installed three the same afternoon they were received. One ties everything in the entertainment unit together, another ties everything in the office together, the third & fourth are being used in the den, and the fifth is a reserve. Very pleased with the quality and capability of these items.

We use this in my son's room where there are limited accessible outlets.  TV is plugged in 1 outlet and the USB are used for Roku and phone.  No complaints from my son and don't have a power strip on the ground to get stepped on.
We use ours for a charging station for everyone to leave their phones at and charge. It works great and you get a fast charge with the USB and C ports

For my wife’s Sewing /Sitting room.  Now she & Friend can have use of power & charging options without sacrificing the TV & lamp being plugged it.The star rating for this is asking me to read it for traveling. This is not a travel item. This is for a “permanent” attachment to your wall outlet.Feels solid in construction. We removed the original decorative face plate to ensure a VERY solid and sturdy fit.  We have ordered 2 more for the house.
I liked the different angles this power plug provided.  We have a desk and a side table close together and I can easily plug in a device from either place.

I love this. I know there are a bunch of these on Amazon from various sellers and manufacturers which is fine. I just am so happy that I can attach so many different devices to this in a limited amount of counter space. I can charge my smart phone and kindle at the same time as well as have a couple of small appliances attached too.
I used this item in my home office. The performance has been outstanding. It powers some of my office equipment. It charges by phone and tablet. I would recommend this item.
I replaced the old cover plate on island receptacle, plugged this baby in, and now the kids have a new charging station for their devices. All in one place. 😊
Needed more outlets but didn’t want the power strip cord mess. Tried this instead and it has been great. Works awesome and is much cleaner look. Great price as well!

reviewTitle: Quality Power Strip with Lots of Space
reviewDescription: This replaced an ugly power strip I had that was necessary to plug in all my stuff on my nightstand because of bulky power plugs that took 2-3 slots. This has much more room, the USB ports work nicely, and looks way better than a huge rectangle laying in the floor. Great product, especially on sale. The screw to hold it in place for duplex outlets was a nice touch.
After having for 3 months it still works but the USB charger will not work you have to use by Outlet

reviewTitle: This allows you to add extra USB ports
reviewDescription: This allows you to add extra USB ports as well as plugs. It takes just a few minutes to install.
This is was a great way to expand my outlet, unfortunately the bottom outlet does not provide any power, but all others do.
These are really good, they can be used for charging different products without having to use charging blocks

reviewTitle: Convenient, easy to install. Not exactly "White".
reviewDescription: I installed three of these on my kitchen island, which is painted white. They work fine, but as they are a bit large, they really stand out. They are not quite white. They are more of a grey/putty color. Not bad, but not white.

reviewTitle: Works well for all your cords
reviewDescription: This outlet is very practical and actually has more plugs than I use. To save energy, we know we should unplug devices from the outlets because many operate in a "standby" mode.The only issue with this outlet was that the little green light in the middle stopped working within 24 hours after installation. I still will use this outlet and may purchase another for one other room. The price is affordable.
Ive been using this for my tv, xbox, and wifi router and its been working perfectly, no dead sockets and lots of different kinds of outlets.
Only downside is wish it had a night light on it other than that like it

reviewTitle: I wish it plugged into both outlets.
reviewDescription: It only plugs into one outlet. And requires it be screwed in. Otherwise, works great.
Won’t fit if you have a dual socket and light switch side by side.

I purchased this product to provide more versatility for a bedside outlet and it does its job perfectly. No more having to plug in an appliance across the room!Two cons:1. It is quite big/bulky, so I do not plan to travel with it.2. I wish the light wasn't constantly shining - it's annoying at night.

I really like this product. I use one at home and when I travel.  When I am at a hotel I don't need to plug my electronics all around the room.  I just plug this in and perfect.  Thank you for making this product , very nice

I installed this in my kitchen where my family likes to charge their devices. I have tried lots of different adapters. This one is sturdy and has the most pets that I have found. We can charge all our devices and still have outlets open for other users.

I bought this for my bathroom. I can now have my light up mirror, towel warmer, charger, and Bluetooth all plugged in at once without having to swap one for another. I love that it's a surge protector too. I may end up getting a second one for my kitchen.

We’ve got a TV mounted above a short/long dresser in the bedroom. The outlet is directly behind the dresser and if I added a power strip it would cause a mess and we would have to move the dresser away from the wall further.This outlet is slim enough to keep the dresser closer to the wall, youll benefit most if you use the 4 side plugs and not the front

I can’t stand the floor extensions. The cords are always too thick, the actual power strip never wanes to stay in place… I was tired of it being the way. I bought one of these and it’s amazing. Cords aren’t pretty. It’s wild seeing how many usb cords I need. But this at least feels far more organized and out of the way. Fits into the outlet no issue. Would highly recommend for anyone that hates power strips and wants the fire hazard off the floor. This seems much safer.
I'n not sure as to why we rate a vendor that has the foresight to stock a product with Amazon, but if it makes you feel good here's a 5 star rating.

Not something for traveling. There are plug in multi-outlet devices for that purpose. This item is very versatile with lots of different style outlets. I don't plan to use them all, but glad they are there for when I need them. Appears well made. There is a downside to this item. It mounts into an existing duplex outlet. My problem is that you can only plug it in to the TOP outlet (to cover the wall opening). The outlets I wanted to use it on have the top outlet connected to a wall switch, and the bottom outlets are live 100% of the time. It would be nice if they would make a version of this where the outlets on the top of this item connect electrically to the top (wall) outlet, and the outlets on the bottom of this item connect electrically to the bottom (wall) outlet. BTW, if this were offered, it could still be used on outlets where both outlets are are live 100% of the time. Please get back to me on this . . . .[ update - 2 mo ] After 2 months the USB outlets stopped charging.

reviewTitle: Multiport Charging on wall mounted surge protector
reviewDescription: This item is has good construction and easy to install. It gives multiple electrical outlets and 4 charging connections including a USB C charging port. The only limitation is that total charging current is 4.8 amps shared between the four ports. I would really prefer that each charging port support 2.4 amps.

I have zero electrical or handiness experience, and this was a piece of cake for me to install in under five minutes. I’ve been using it for months in a busy spot in my kitchen and always have at least four things plugged in. Whenever I need to use the air fryer or blender, I plug them I here, and have never had any issues with my phone or electronics charging slowly, even with multiple small kitchen appliances running on it. Totally worth the money and it has been a game changer. Buy it!
Love the USB ports. Looks good on the wall. Gives us more plug-in options
Needed multiple outlets and ports. Needs longer anchoring screws. Does not fit securely into outlets.
It is okay but it takes up both of my plug in spots.
This is a basic protection device. Sturdy mount great multiple type outlets
You have to remove the faceplate on outlet and screw this in.

reviewTitle: Available ports for all different devices
reviewDescription: The surge protector. Very ergonomic, user friendly and fits well with room
Some of plug ins don’t let me insert completely so it’s useless.
This is a great product. The price is very reasonable and installation is extremely easy and quick. I have had zero problems with it. All the outlets work.
But more type USB and style “C” connections would be better.

reviewTitle: Odd stud, but it's still a great unit!
reviewDescription: The reason why that I say it is "odd" is because it won't just plug into your outlet - there is some kind of plastic stud (?) that sticks up and must be broken off before it'll plug in; it broke off with a little bit of effort but not so much that I would consider it hard to remove. And once you get it plugged in and lock it down (with the long screw that comes in the box) that's in the middle it's tight to the wall, secure and it works great. We all love it!And it's really awesome that you have multiple USB ports on it so that you can charge your phones or whatever else or just plug in your phone or whatever to play sooner music while you're doing dishes or cleaning and then you don't have to worry about the batteries draining down (and it will obviously charge your phone or whatever while you have it plugged in playing the music). The plug outlets are arranged in a great pattern too, easy to use formatting.

reviewTitle: USB-C port failed after a few months, the rest is still working at 1 year
reviewDescription: I've been using it just over a year, and MOST of it has been working fine, but unfortunately ONE of the USB-A charging ports failed after about 6 months.  The other 2 USB-A ports and the USB-C port have been working fine.  The strange thing is that that USB-A port was the LEAST used of the USB ports, it had a Lightning cable for charging my phone while using it in bed, but normally that phone sits on a wireless charger.  So I probably only used that USB-A port a couple dozen hours at most before it quit.

reviewTitle: Nice unit...but falls off the wall constantly
reviewDescription: This charging unit falls off the wall constantly due to the weight of the chargers that are plugged into it.  It does come with a mounting screw that doesn't to avoid this but the screw hole in the unit does not align with any of the outlets in out house.  For the money it's nice but I've been forced to plug it in horizontally  on another circuit breaker extension so it doesn't fall off the wall.  Not exactly a clean way to use the unit.

This may work great, but I bought it specifically for travel, since it is promoted for that purpose. It's too big for travel, and I had to send it back. It actually comes with a big long screw to secure the middle, which would be great if you wanted to use it semi-permanently in your home. Suggestion for the company: If you're honest about its ease of use for travel (or lack thereof), you may be able to avoid getting reviews with low stars.

I bought this wall charger for the outlet next to my bed.  Last night, I smelled that familiar electric smell near my head and discovered that my outlet that this wall charger was plugged into was shorted out.  I can't imagine this had any other cause than this wall charger that was plugged in.  I am returning this and also have to replace my wall socket.  I'm glad I was home to react to this.

I bought 3 of these and one of them worked for 2days and then ALL USB ports quit working.  The only thing that worked were the 120V outlets.  I hope the other ones work for a longer period of time.  Suggests poor quality control. Also I could not find a website to contact them

reviewTitle: Reliable at First, But Quality Declines Over Time
reviewDescription: Pros:Initially worked great upon purchase in July.Provided extra outlets for convenient use.Cons:Quality seems to have degraded over time.Green light indicating functionality now requires manual pressure to appear.Reliability has diminished since initial use.Overall Thoughts:I was pleased with this outlet extender when I first purchased it in July. It offered additional outlets and performed reliably. However, I've noticed a decline in its quality over time. Now, I find myself having to hold it in place for the green light to indicate functionality, which is disappointing. While it served its purpose initially, the decrease in reliability is a concern.

reviewTitle: USB C port stops charging after some time
reviewDescription: This is a great product, great design, except the USB C charging port, the reason why I purchased the product, stops emitting a charge to my device. I am observing the outlet, so far I can say that after a few minutes of doing what it is supposed to do, provide current to my laptop, it stops. I do not see how could this be a problem on "my" side. If someone does not reach out to me, I will return it.

This product worked flawlessly and was a huge help with telework due to multiple devices.  Then it suddenly stopped working with no reset nor indication why it stopped.  It took an electrician to see the circuit within this unit caused the circuit breaker to not restart.  I’m hoping the company sees this as a replacement would be greatly appreciated (this product was purchased last July of 2023).

I bought this device since I thought it would be the answer to charging several USB devices. 5 outlets and 4 USB chargers would have been great. Well it did work great for about 5 months. Then the USB chargers died. Now it's no better than the simple multi-outlet devices and actually worse since I can only plug in 5 devices not 6.
Quit working after only two months. Cannot return it just lost my money. Not very durable only used in one outlet and it stopped working! Terrible product do not waste your money!

I bought a number of these units to provide extra outlets in a number of the rooms in my house and to add the convenience of device charging in those locations as well. They do both of those things quite well and offer a small degree of surge suppression as well.I only have two issues. This device is very bulky in size. The attached photos show that quite well and I'm sure that they could have been made thinner by a quarter or even a third easily. So, not meant for tight spaces. Second (And this is an issue with a number of other wall-mounted surge suppressors I have seen as well.), there is a LOT of light bleeding out from the USB ports and that's in addition to the LED indicator showing that surge suppression is active. See attached photo. If you put these in a bedroom, you're going to have a very bright room at night when you're trying to sleep. Good luck with that!

As a general AC outlet extender, it's fine.  I have no idea whether or not it's good at surge protection (I HOPE it is).  As far as USB charging, I tried using each port to recharge several devices using different USB cords and got ... nothing.  I gave up trying to use it for USB charging.  Maybe my unit is defective.  I can't image that I'm doing anything wrong in connecting to the USB ports -- that's pretty straightforward.

This item does not sit flush to the cabinet. I re-read the instructions and its supposed to sit over the faceplate and flush with the wall. It doesn't, but it does sit on there securely with the long screw that is provided. All the plugs and usb work, so if doesn't sit flush, not too much of a big deal, but wanted to make aware.

reviewTitle: Falls out of outlet without the screw.
reviewDescription: Took it on a cruise last week. It was too heavy for the outlet, and I had no way to use the screw that was included, so had to prop it up which only worked about half the time (it kept getting bumped) I’m guessing it would be fine at home under normal circumstances.

Got this so that I could have better access to my plugs.  I am giving a 3 instead of a 5 because the holes are not properly sized and it is difficult to near impossible to use the outlet.  A bit disappointing but not worth the trouble of returning

reviewTitle: Good spacing but Surge Protector already fried
reviewDescription: The spacing of the outlets is nice and which accommodates bulky plugs.  I don't know if it was a freakish thing but I had two monitors plugged in along with a plug for my desk.  When I used the last outlet for the third monitor, there was spark and the green light went out.  Nothing was pulling powering from the desk, just the two monitors.The item stop working and their isn't any reset button.  I had tested the item on another outlet but wasn't working still.  Luckily, I had another outlet similar but a different company.  That one is working fine with all the monitors and additional items plugged into it.  So, I would have giving a higher star if it wasn't for this incident.
It doesn’t stay flush to the wall and consequently loses contact. There’s got to be a way to correct that, but I don’t know what that is.
Couldn’t use on cruise because it Is surge protected. It also didn’t fit a double outlet at home.

reviewTitle: Missing the long screw to secure.
reviewDescription: I didn’t get the long screw to secure this item and need to get one.

reviewTitle: One Plug on Back Side and No Reset Switch
reviewDescription: The product is listed as a surge protector, but there's no reset button.  The only "indication" that it's a surge protector is the green light in the center of the device.  I'd feel better about being able to use more of the outlets on also if it plugged into both receptacles instead of just one.  I know that's all normal strip design surge protectors do also, but at the very least it'd make the unit more stable.
it is perfect, plenty of outlets and voltage safety.
The angle makes it easier to plug in chargers
Un buen adaptador, funciona a la perfección.
A little hard to fit dut works
It works. Kinda large but it does the job
Make sure you purchase when discounted!!!
No dislikes. And easy to use!
Great ..Keeps everything organized
Really come in handy in out of the way wall outlets!
Works well for our needs.

reviewTitle: Good product but USB-C does not work for Apple iPad (as of Feb 2024)
reviewDescription: Great little product! Love the extra plus as well as how they are angled to be out of the way of the way of the other plugs. Being screwed in really makes sense. Bought specifically for the USB options and having 4 (three regular and one C) is great! Only complaint is that USB-C does not work with Apple iPad Pro which was why I specifically bought this model. Wish it was specified in the description that it’s not MFI. Still keeping it for all the other features.

It’s great but it loses a star because I had to go find a screw the would hold this item in place. I do like how it has a little light that tells you it’s plugged in right and also makes it easier to find with low lighting. It’s great and it has really come in handy but I ordered two and no screw in either box.

Installed this on an outlet in a room where my kids and their friends hang out all the time. They used to annoyingly unplug things to charge their phones on this outlet and leave them unplugged. Now, it's easy for them to charge any number of things while not bothering the few others things that are plugged in there. It's also super versatile with many different charging port types.

reviewTitle: Streamline Your Outlet Woes with the QINLIANF 5 Outlet Extender!
reviewDescription: I can't recommend the QINLIANF 5 Outlet Extender enough! It's been a game-changer in simplifying my scattered outlet problem. This extender offers ample outlets and USB ports, all in one convenient location. The surge protection is a great bonus for added peace of mind. The build quality is excellent, and the design is sleek and compact. If you're looking to tidy up your outlet situation and keep all your devices charged, this is the perfect solution!"

reviewTitle: Will not adapt to newer duplex plugs
reviewDescription: The Quinlianf outlet extender will only fit the older round duplex outlets, not the more modern rectangular outlet.  I has to change the existing duplex out back to an older, basic duplex outlet with the center threaded hole to attach the extender.

reviewTitle: Will not screw onto modern outlets
reviewDescription: Works well enough for a static environment provided you are not unplugging/ plugging connectors.The screw cannot be used with modern outlets, see picture of a modern outlet.  It is tight enough fit and does wraparound the outlet plate to the wall so is moderately stable without the screw.

The Wall Charger Surge Protector's fast charging capabilities ensure that my devices are juiced up quickly and efficiently. Whether it's my smartphone, tablet, or laptop, I can count on this surge protector to deliver power reliably and swiftly.
I purchased this device for the added electrical outlets.  The USB charging ports are an added feature which would be a better feature if at least one port was a Rapid Charge or Quick Charge port.
I bought this one a month or so ago to use in the kitchen area.  It turned out that this outlet doesn’t fit the GFI so I kept it and used it somewhere else….just FYI

reviewTitle: Bright light on all the time
reviewDescription: Just a heads up… the product works well, but there is a bright green light that stays on all the time. If you’re using this in a bedroom, you may want to keep that in mind.
Works fine so far
product good so far

reviewTitle: Good value for how much it cost

This is my 3rd one I’ve purchased. I have them now in my kitchen, living room, and bedroom .  It’s very easy to install. It’s got enough outlets for everything I need to plug in. Always nice to have the surge protection & the night light is really bright.

reviewTitle: So good you will want more.
reviewDescription: I like this product.  It makes les it easy to add outlets to any room.  It takes up space a little bit bigger than the original outlet, but adds 3 more places to plug into with standard plugs, and gives you three USB(regular) and a USB (c).  You can fasten it in place using a screw that goes where you would attach the receptacle cover.  Make sure you remove the original screw or it won't go... Don't ask me how I know this.  So good I went back and bought another.
I purchased two of these. Unfortunately, one of them does not work. The main outlet in the front just does not work. Just installed it, but passed the window for returns.
I’d like to swap for another one, but I am past the return date. Surely these are expected to work more than 60 days. Is there any type of warranty?

I got this bc I live in an older house and needed more plugs in the living room and thought this was perfect bc it has a built in surge protector. Install was easy but the plugs don’t work unless the item has a 3rd prong and only the ones on the face work. The side outlets don’t work at all. Only reason it’s not a one star is because the USB outlets work. I would’ve returned it and gotten a different one but life happened and I missed the window.
Like the multiple outlets and ports, the only issue was that USB ports either didn't work or stopped working.

reviewTitle: Packaging appeared to have been tampered
reviewDescription: Received package packages and was a bit concerned and disappointed on how the package of the product was delivered. It appears that it might have been used and retuned, which is fine. But should have not been sold as “New”.
Worked great for 6 months, then all the outlet came loose and started sparking.
Doesn’t support all ports at once , nothing fully charged after overnite
The green LED will pierce your eyes and will be a constant annoyance in rooms where you sleep.There doesnt appear to be an obvious way to turn this off.
I thought this was going to be the perfect solution. When I plugged it into the outlet, what happened is that it was too heavy and it was falling.
Some of the bottom plugs stopped working after two weeks.
Full function device. Product sticks out further than I desired which limits placement options and that's the only reason rating is not 5.

reviewTitle: Covers two plugs can't use just one plug
reviewDescription: Dislike that it covered both plugs thought I was going to be able to use my other Outlet and then have this in addition

When the electrician plugged it in, the prongs bumped the metal (brass?) wall plate.  The adaptor and the new outlet he had just installed got fried, the metal wall plate got welded to the adaptor.  Learning points: Turn off the power before plugging in or unplugging?  Don't use metal wall plates. Or, the electrician's solution - remove the wall plate; period; not needed.I had bought several.  Haven't used the others enough yet to rate it.  Compromised on 4 stars because, at the least, the instructions need a warning added to not use it with metal wall plates.
Seems so far to work just fine.  However, using the USB port takes longer to charge a device
Can use outlet and multi charger same time and not to worry of loosing charger box everytime

reviewTitle: Gave as gift.  She liked it!!
reviewDescription: Gift for friend who needed more places to recharge items.  Easy instructions for installation.
Arrived quickly, works as expected. Just wish someone would add extra USB C outlets.
Plug it in and go! No wiring and gets rid of phone adapters. Win win!
I love these, it makes plugging things in so easy

reviewTitle: Beware not USB-c compliant - Buyer Beware
reviewDescription: Unless you read all of the information in detail, until you try to charge a phone. That this item CAN NOT CHARGE USB c phobes or other similar devices. Further, and obviously, it is not 3.0 compliant. Useless USB ports, even on the "updated" devices. Buyer Beware

reviewTitle: Good at first, but USB ports stop working
reviewDescription: I’ve had this for a few months and loved it and now 2/3 of the USB ports have stopped working. I love that it was a space saver to plug all our devices in but sad it’s not working properly. We’ll still use it because the extra plugs are nice but now have to buy extra charging blocks to have around.
Worried it will get bumped off and expose outlet to kids and pets
Nice device. Hate the green light on all the time;/

reviewTitle: Comes with a plastic bar right in the middle forcing you to plug into upper outlet
reviewDescription: It is good to have multiple outlets and usb outlets. However, if you have a room wired in a way that the upper outlet is controlled by a light switch, all outlets on this will be powered off.
I believe this is a good product, but it did not work on my home because the outlets are on a switch, and it would not work because of that issue.
Only half of the outlets seem to work. I’ve been having some trouble with the USB outlets but I still think it’s a good purchase.
Purchased these for outlets that are visible and not covered by furniture, still trying to decide if I like them or not.

Product is and does what it says. However, it is NOT designed for GFCI outlets. We had to cut off the plastic bit on the lower portion to fit it, and we cannot secure it with the long screw because well... all of our outlets are standard GFCI.Not sure why they wouldnt make this or an option of this with GFCI more in mind. But we make do and it does the job. The usb and usb c ports are phenomenal additions that were needed.

I have 6 from this account and a few more. They are great for functionality. There is only 1 thing holding them back, and that the is extremely long screw in the middle have no "keeper". As a result, the screw falls out easily. I have tried replacing this locally, but there seems to be nothing readily available.If these screws are proprietary, I will happily buy some but they cannot be found.

reviewTitle: Converts 2 plugs to 5, plus adds USB
reviewDescription: Very happy with these. My only suggestion would be to make this plug longer and deeper.  Any larger plug you are plugging in to it only fits on the ONE plug on the front.

this my 2nd one. 1st one i got was by POWERIVER  and  did not work as perfect at this. that one, the face place needs to come off from the wall then install.  But this,  dont have this!  just unscrew, attach this and screw back and done!!!
Make sure you use the screw, I didn't and when you pull the plug out the whole things comes off the wall.  But otherwise it's okay.  Charges good, no problems.
Larger than others I’ve purchased. Check your existing outlets especially older homes. The baseboard was too close on outlet this was bought for, I just used it elsewhere. Very helpful product.
The equipment appears robust, and during the operatioit it has worked very well. I recommend this product not only have a 10 v outlets  ports and USB charging ports.
I've wanted this for so long, and it's great quality. It just doesn't fit the plugs that I need it to because it needs to screw in.
This won't stay in the outlet must be screwed in its to heavy my outlets don't have center screw. to large to travel with.

reviewTitle: A Good Answer for Anyone With Lots of Rechargeable Devices
reviewDescription: Like most of the people we know, my wife and I own multiple devices with rechargeable batteries. Phones, cameras, tablets... you name it. After a weekend away, nearly every convenient outlet in our house plays host to at least one rechargeable device.This wall charger helps simplify matters. Since most devices don't draw much current, we can plug almost everything that needs charging into one outlet. With the added reassurance it's also a surge protector.It simplifies getting all our devices recharged after a weekend away. And the surge protector offers a degree of confidence our frequent lightning storms (We live in southern Florida.) won't fry our devices. It's easy and quick to install... though the instructions leave something to be desired.As far as traveling goes, don't bother. This is a household device, and isn't appropriate for travel use.But, if you have a half-dozen rechargeable devices and struggle to get everything charged in a timely manner, this could be the solution you seek.

reviewTitle: Slow charging time for my phone
reviewDescription: I purchased this because my kids keep taking my boxes. I figured if its an extension cord I could keep things more organized.  What I found out is that it will take hours to charge my phone using this way, so this is a downside if I need it charged in a short amount of time.

reviewTitle: Functional USB Wall Charger with Unnecessary Green Light
reviewDescription: This USB Wall Charger is a functional device that works well. The sturdiness of the product is impressive, as the center screw installs directly into the plug. However, the constant green light can be annoying and unnecessary. Overall, an excellent option for anyone in need of a reliable USB wall charger, but keep in mind the potential annoyance of the green light.

reviewTitle: Will not pass thru switched outlet
reviewDescription: Will not pass thru switched outlet only 1 plug on back need 2 for switched outlet
It took way to long to charge and difficulty finding good plug to use.

reviewTitle: Some ports are dying after one year
reviewDescription: I am not sure what is lifetime of this product. The real test of a product is its longevity. After little more than one year some of its ports are dying. Out of 4 only 3 are are working. If I have to buy it every year that may be my choice.

I bought three these at one time. One out of the three doesn’t work. To get it replaced. I have to jump through hoops. So I would look at a different item from now on not willing to do business with this company anymore.
I was disappointed that I was  unable to obtain power for either my iPad Pro or my Alexa without adding a plug at the end of each power cord. Otherwise, this device has a tidy appearance.

It is bulky but handy.The charging power is the sum of all of the ports so it is somewhat slow to charge things.  It is handy though bc you don’t have to worry about losing the usb charger blocks.  The light in the center is not necessary. It is just a waste of energy.It is an ok product overall.

reviewTitle: Is not stable if you aint got a third hole
reviewDescription: If you dont have the hole in the middle, is remarkably very unstable

reviewDescription: the charge for a single unit is slow and even more slower with multiple units plugged in.

reviewTitle: Too big for my kitchen plug
reviewDescription: I got this for my kitchen plug but it was too big. I’ll find another use.

Pros: has plenty of available sockets and good layout and reasonable price. Cons: Very slow to charge an Iphone or an Android phone. Don't have spec on parasitic (no load) power consumption. I dedicated it to running an amazon Stick since it doesn't have smart chip to do fast charge. OK for that purpose.
Disappointed.  The included screw is too short to reach the receptacle, so it won't screw in where it would be stationary.

As you can see from my video, it’s a little touchy with the power going in and out. Can be frustrating when you leave thinking your phone is charging and come back and the power is off. When it works though the power is strong.

I purchased 4 of these units. The USB C port did not work on one of them. The other 3 seem to work fine.

reviewTitle: Great product, just didn’t last long for me
reviewDescription: This is a very useful product, charges my devices super quick, but died about a month after receiving, so that’s why I gave it 3 stars.
Product not sturdy, any movement/plugging in or unplugging turned the whole thing off. I ended up buying a different one with 8 plugs instead on Amazon too and it was much better than this crap

I thought this would be better than it is, and would in fact be perfect except for 2 problems.It does have a screw to hold it in place, which was a priority for me, but the screw is loose  and may get lost. Other units I own have the screw permanently held in place.The other small deficit that is disappointing is that the unit will not suck tight against the wall. My older one would. This one stays at least 1/4 inch away, so it looks ugly and rocks around a bit, even when screwed in tightly.
Seems like a good product. But they sent one that was previously opened and charged full price of a new one.

Decent extender, but not a warm white; almost gray. The unit extends enough to cover a standard size wall plate. With a typical plug plugged into the unit the plug extends 3 inches.or more. When installed everything works as described. The only other possible issue is the one time use surge protection. There is no reset.

reviewTitle: Good enough for the sale price
reviewDescription: I like the spacing of the outlets on the side and the USB A and C, and one cannot beat the $12 sale,  but I was spoiled by the 360 Electrical outlet extenders I bought 3-4 years ago which are perfection except pricey, and no C USB.The Qinlianf 5 has a rougher exterior,  ugly greyish color,  good USB's outlets but the AC outlets are absolutely not smooth, I almost bent a plug first time I used one trying to fit it in, then it would not come out.  Spent some time working on the 5 outlets but it is easier to leave appliances plugged in.

reviewTitle: Nice product, but it does not fit well on the wall
reviewDescription: I liked this product based on the description. However, I was not able to secure it on the socket using the screw that was provided. I tried moultiple approaches, including disassembly of the the wall outlet, but no luck.

The overall concept was excellent but when trying to use more than one socket on here the weight would cause it so constantly come out of the wall socket. I have since returned this item as it wasn’t as useful as I thought.

Two units ordered with one perfect, as advertised. The second had a large plastic piece of "flashing" in the bottom hole that made it unusable for the front facing plugin. One out of two is a small sample, but, it severely restricts our ability to use it.
The wall charger only has two plugs to recharge our iPhones & iPad.  There are other plugs & the charger fits flat against the wall for space saving.Not real happy with product.

reviewTitle: It kept falling out of my original socket.
reviewDescription: It kept falling out of my original socket.

I like the number and variety of plugs, but the way it is designed makes it wiggle a lot when you plug it into the wall (even after removing the outlet cover screwing in the USB charger screw). The first bad design decision was to only have one 3 prong plug that plugs into the wall. This thing is big and having two plugs would have made it significantly more stable. They should have a least made a second "dummy" plastic plug so that it plugged into both wall receptacles. The second bad design is that the back is not recessed. Even when you remove the cover on the wall outlet, the actual outlet still protrudes past the drywall about an 1/8th of an inch (or more). Without the back being recessed, the USB Wall Charger will not sit flush with the wall, which makes it even more unstable. I wound up trimming the wall plug box some to allow the plug to sit further into it. But even with the USB charger flush with the wall, it still wiggled around a bit because it has only one plug to secure it to the wall outlet. Now that the 1/8th inch gap wall closed between the charger and the wall, I was able to put double sided tape at all four corners to eliminate the wiggle. It's really amazing that products get manufactured and shipped with such obvious issues. Did no one plug this thing in before giving the green light on the final design?

reviewTitle: It almost fits the wall Socket
reviewDescription: This wall charger has an excellent design and it works very well with a standard outlet.  Of course, as noted in its descriptive data, it cannot EASILY be used with a GDCI (Ground Fault Circuit Interrupter) outlet, such as those found in kitchens counter areas and bathrooms, as those outlets DO NOT have a center screw.  The charger has a lower plastic insert for the "standard" lower ground slot on the standard outlet, and the insert is ever-so-slightly lower in the GDCI outlet.  Thus, in order to use the wall charger with a GDCI outlet you will need to remove the lower plastic insert, AND, you may find the outlet slightly looser when mounted to the outlet (because it is only plugged into it).  Nonetheless, IT WILL WORK, and I like mine.  Mine is mounted to a GDCI outlet in my kitchen with some Duct Tape positioned on the back lower area where the insert should have been (firefighter engineering)!

Was able to solder it back in place easily enough and it works, but still debating how safe I feel using them.

reviewTitle: NO 'fail-to-close' safety feature. Poor clamping voltage. NOT UL listed.
reviewDescription: You want a surge suppressor to have a 'fail-to-close' safety feature … "to stop power to your devices once surge protection expires." (Alternate related terms for this feature include 'fail-to-safe' or 'fail-to-shutdown' or 'automatic shutdown technology.') Most suppressors DO have it. There is NO mention of this product having any 'fail-to-close' safety feature (1) on this webpage, (2) on the back of the product or (3) in the User's Manual that comes with it. So you can safely assume it does NOT have it.Oversimplified, a suppressor doesn't 'kick in' until the voltage exceeds its 'clamping voltage/specification.' (Alternative related terms include 'UL1449 let-through' and 'voltage protection rating.') So you would want that number to be lower (to be better). Relying on various online sources, it appears safe to say that 330 volts is common on better suppressors, 400 volts is considered merely adequate, 500 volts is considered to be borderline inadequate. The seller now claims the clamping voltage/specification for THIS device is 600 volts. Further, there is NO mention of the clamping voltage/specification for this product (1) on the back of the product or (2) in the User's Manual that comes with it.[ I submitted a question – twice – to the seller asking for the 'clamping voltage/specification.' Twice the question was ignored by the seller. Meanwhile I saw the seller DID post an answer to three other questions the same day I first inquired. Apparently the seller did not want to discuss the matter of clamping voltage at all. After about a week the seller posted in Q&A, after someone else asked, that the clamping voltage is 600V. ]This product is NOT UL listed. This product does NOT have a UL hologram sticker on it. To get such a listing and such a sticker, the maker must submit sample units to UL for testing that assures the device meets UL standards. The back of the device states "Conforms to UL Standard 498A." THAT is a standard for a wall tap, not a surge suppressor. It is a general safety standard (such as 'designed without sharp edges,' 'designed without parts that children might ingest,' and so forth). IT IS UL 1449 (3RD EDITION) that is the standard to which SUPPRESSORS are commonly held by UL. The maker may claim that the device conforms to some kind of UL standard, but without a UL hologram sticker and listing, the device has not actually been found by UL to conform.I bought this gizmo for an outlet I do not use at all … so I will have a convenient place to OCCASIONALLY recharge cell phone battery chargers, my GPS device and so on via this device's USB ports. I suppose I can trust it to do that from time to time.However, given the opaque nature of the device's actual specifications and ability, as described above, you should NOT assume it fully functions as a true full-featured surge suppressor should. Or trust valuable electronic devices to be fully protected by it as if it does.

reviewDescription: This wall charger looks sharp. But the one I received is a lemon. The AC connections work fine. But none of the USB connectors work. I tried charging several USB charged devices. None of the devices showed a "charging" status in the USB ports. They worked just fine in the normal AC ports, when I added an AC adapter.  However, the whole reason for this purchase was to be able to charge directly into USB and avoid needing AC adapters. So I am returning this wall charger.
Good solid quality

reviewTitle: I Must Be Inept and Clumsy
reviewDescription: I bought 15 of these outlets to install all over our home. Something tells me that they are really good. I’m still waiting to find out for sure. I’ve had them for several months now and have not been able to install just ONE successfully. I spend at least two hours on each installation attempt. Still no dice.
